Within a few years Gloria hopes that her business will continue to grow and become one of the biggest and well-known in the area.  Gloria also wants to see her children graduate and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras,  Septemeber 2013.

loans.use: to buy corn for her business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 45 years old and is married with 12 children. She earns income mainly through the sale of crops and livestock, and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Margret grows cassava, bananas, maize and beans. She also rears chickens. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Margret looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to serve her village with agricultural information that will help farmers improve crop and animal yields. Margret will use added income as a CKW to pay school fees for her children and meet other family needs. Her dream is to see her children attain quality education up to university.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 31 years old and is married with three children. His income is mainly from the sale of crops and livestock and he earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools.

On his land Jacob grows cassava, coffee, maize, bananas and beans. He also has cows, chicken and goats. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Jacob looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to share with the village vital agricultural information about better farming methods that will help improve crop yields. With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Jacob will be able to pay school fees for his children and invest in his farm’s future. His biggest dream in life is to go back to serve his community faithfully and provide them with information when they need it.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es socio de la "Unión Regional", asociación a la que entrega todo su café para que sea procesado y exportado, por lo que siempre está pendiente que su producto sea de la mejor calidad. Para esta cosecha necesita un crédito el cual utilizará para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar a los cortadores de café que contratará para que lo ayuden en los trabajos en su finca. Al final de la cosecha pagará el financiamiento.
texts.en: Eduardo is a member of the "Unión Regional" association, where he takes all his coffee for it to be processed and exported.  He always hopes for his coffee to be of the best quality.  For this harvest, Eduardo needs a loan in order to buy fertilisers and to hire coffee cutters.  The coffee cutters will help with the work on the farm.  Eduardo will pay back the loan at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to pay for coffee cutters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee cutters.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is from Gyumri town where he lives with his parents, grandmother, wife and two little children. As the only breadwinner of the family Artur works day and night earning income to cover his family's expenses. He has been running a small business for several years. He owns a small oven where he cooks pork and sells it to locals. Now, because of financial difficulties that the family currently faces, Artur lacks financial means to renovate his oven. He has requested this loan to purchase meat and renovate the oven. Artur has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Artur to be able to increase his capital and provide better service to his customers. Artur hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay to renovate his oven and purchase meat

loans.name: Jockus

texts.en: Jockus is 25 years old and is married with three children. He earns his income from the sale of crops and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Jockus grows beans, maize, coffee, cassava and bananas. He also rears chickens. Jockus has served as a CKW for the last two years and looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to share with his community agricultural information and help them adopt better farming practices. With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Jockus will be able to expand his poultry farm, boost the working capital of his retail shop and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Jockus

texts.en: Jockus is 61 years old and is married with 10 children. He earns his income from the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Jockus grows bananas, vegetables, maize and beans. He also has chickens and goats. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Jockus looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to share with his village vital agricultural information and help them adopt better farming methods. With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Jockus is looking at constructing a permanent house for his family. His biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Adil

texts.en: Adil is a 47-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small village in the Bolnisi district. His sons go to a local school and his wife is a housekeeper. Adil is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of land where he grows potatoes and haricot. Adil decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase a minibus. When the minibus is purchased, he will start trading fruits and vegetables to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start a trading business

loans.name: Banco Mujer Esfuerzo Mutuo Group

texts.es: Doña Vilma es integrante de Banco Mujer Esfuerzo Mutuo tiene 46 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos, pero a su cargo solo está su hija menor y si nieto. Ella en una mujer muy valiente ya que siempre ha buscado la forma de sacar adelante a su familia pese a sus problemas de salud, ha sido operada 2 veces del corazón. Aún así Doña Vilma trabaja de sol a sol en su pequeña finca de donde cultiva plátano. Este es el cuarto préstamo que solicita, lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos como; semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, bolsas, cajas y otros insumos.  Los deseos de esta señora son mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y tener la posibilidad de pagar servicios de salud privadas para mejorar su salud y seguir trabajando.  Junto a Doña Vilma están el grupo 6 socias más q van invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and a member of the community bank Mujer Esfuerzo Mutuo. She is the mother of three children, but takes care of only one of them and a grandson. Vilma is described as a courageous person because she has always found a way to provide for her family, despite her health problems. She has had two heart operations but still works from sunrise to sunset on her small farm, where she grows plantains.

This is Vilma’s fourth loan, which she will use to buy supplies such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, insecticides, bags and boxes. She says that her dream is to improve her living conditions and to be able to pay for private health care so that she can get better and continue working. Shown in the photo with Vilma are six other members of the group who are going to invest in agricultural businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, insecticides, bags, boxes and other supplies.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is 42 years old, married and has six children. 

He earns his income from the sale of crops and livestock, operating a small retail shop as well as earning a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Ambrose grows rice, maize and beans. He also has cows and goats. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Ambrose looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to share with his village vital agricultural information, help them improve crop yields and consequently, increase their incomes. 

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Ambrose will increase the working capital of his retail shop. His biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey, a 40-year-old married father of four, earns income through the sale of crops and a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land, Geoffrey grows coffee, bananas, maize, beans and cassava. He also has goats and chicken. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Geoffrey looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to deliver agricultural information to farmers in his community. 

Geoffrey will use the additional income earned as a CKW to pay school fees for his children. He looks forward to becoming a successful model farmer and father in his village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weigh scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is a 23-year-old man. He lives with his brother and pensioner grandmother in the small village of the Kvareli district, eastern Georgia. 

Koba is a very hardworking young man. He cultivates family-owned land and sows maize to sell. The income is only seasonal and is not enough for the family.

Koba requested a loan for starting a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,000 Gel for purchasing a used car to start trading fruits and vegetables. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family as they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car to start trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is 30 years old, married and has one child. He earns income mainly from the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Nickson grows maize, cassava, bananas and beans as well as rearing chickens, goats and pigs. After two years of service as a CKW in his village, Nickson looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution and weighing scale) to disseminate actionable information to farmers of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Nickson will be able to build a permanent house and buy more land for agricultural expansion. He looks forward to becoming an exemplary farmer in his village and improving the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie,is 36 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her four children between the ages of one month and 20 years old. Three are in school. She is an 11th grade dropout. 

For 12 years now, she has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes the profit she makes from her business every day. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more rubber dishes (plates, spoons, pans, etc.) for her business. Her plan is to build a house .

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes (plates, spoons, pans, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 35 years old and is married with seven children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Godfrey grows cassava, maize, beans and millet. He also has cows, goats, chickens and sheep. Godfrey has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution, and weighing scale) to share with his community real time agricultural information and advise farmers on best farming practices. With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Godfrey will be able to buy more land for farming and improve his family's standard of living. He looks forward to becoming a model farmer in his community and a point of reference for the agricultural information needs of his village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Karoti 1B Group

texts.en:
Pendo, who is in her mid-20s, is a married mother of three children, two of whom go to school, while the third is still a baby. Since 2004, Pendo has been selling a variety of bathing soaps.  Working from 7.00 am to 9.00 pm daily, she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Pendo's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, her previous loans having helped her to offer a greater variety of soap for sale; the profits enabled her to buy a plot of land. All of her prior loans have been repaid.  Pendo will use this one to replenish her stocks of soap. She dreams of building her own house.

Pendo will share this loan with her loan group "Karoti 1B" which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of soap to sell.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 31 years old and is married with three children. He earns income mainly from the sale of crops and livestock. He also earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Augustine grows coffee, beans, maize, bananas and cassava. He also has chickens and goats. Augustine has served as a CKW for the last two years and now looks forward to renewing his contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution and weighing scale) to share with his village, agricultural information about best farming practices. With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Augustine will be able to use his farm land better and increase his crop yields. His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer and help his community to become free from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 33 years old and is married with five children. His income comes from the sale of crops and livestock and he earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Wilson grows coffee, maize, bananas, cassava and beans. He also has chickens and goats. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Wilson looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to share with the village vital agricultural information about better farming methods that will help improve crop yields. 

With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Wilson will increase the size of his farm acreage. His biggest dream in life is to go back to university and pursue an agriculture-related course that will build his capacity to improve his farming and serve the community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es: Florentino es un señor muy esforzado y  trabajador, necesita continuar con su negocio de venta de productos de uso doméstico, ya que de los ingresos que le genera  esta actividad depende su sustento diario. Debido a la época que se acerca las ventas crecen,  por lo que Florentino necesita también comprar más productos, por lo cual solicita un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000)
texts.en: Florentino is a strong and hardworking man who needs to continue with his business selling products for use in the home.  The income he earns from this activity is needed to support himself every day.  Since the time of year when sales grow is approaching, Florentino needs to purchase more products, so he is requesting a loan of a million colones.

loans.use: to purchase products for use in the home.

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en:
Neckson is 32 years old, married and has three children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock as well as from monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

Neckson also has a small retail shop. On his land, Neckson grows maize, coffee and bananas. He also rears goats and chickens. He has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution, and weighing scale) to share with his community vital agricultural information, help them boost crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the added income he will earn as a CKW, Neckson plans to buy more land to expand his cultivation area, grow more crops and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en:
Meresi is 31 years old, married and has three children. She earns income mainly from the sale of crops and a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local areas including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land Meresi grows beans maize, bananas, beans and cassava. She also has chickens and goats. Meresi has served as a CKW for the last two years and now looks forward to renewing her contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution and weighing scale) to disseminate agricultural information about best farming practices to farmers in her village. 

With the additional income she will earn as a CKW, Meresi will be able to buy more land and increase production. Her dream in life is to build a commercial building in her nearby town as a source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
La señora  María es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo e  hijo en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la elaboración y   venta  de tortillas.
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, leña y cal. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña María espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y que su hijo  se convierta en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Septiembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and son in the south of Honduras. She is described as a responsible, hard-working and honest person. Her business is making and selling tortillas.

Maria is requesting this loan to buy corn, firewood and lime. She says that the loan will allow her to make more tortillas, and she hopes that by improving how she waits on her customers, her sales will increase.

Maria hopes to cover her expenses and improve her and her family’s quality of life a little bit. She hopes that her business will continue to grow, and that in a few years it will become one of the largest and best-known businesses in the area. Maria also hopes that her son will grow up to be a good person, and that he will have better opportunities in life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime to make tortillas.

loans.name: Edita Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Edita  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con su esposo e  hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 10 años.
Doña Edita el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca, arroz, frijoles, carne de pollo, res,  refrescos etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
 Doña Edita espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus  hijos  y  padres   ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos.


Choluteca, Honduras  – Septiembre  del   2013
texts.en:
Edita is a responsible, honest, and hardworking person who lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras. Her business is a local grocery, which she has had for over 10 years.

Edita needs the loan to buy shortening, rice, beans, chicken meat, beef, soft drinks, etc. With the loan she hopes her sales will increase, as she will have more products to offer her clients and will be better able to serve them.

Edita hopes to meet her needs and to make some improvement in her and her family's quality of life. In a few years she hopes that her business will continue to grow, that it will become one of the biggest and best known businesses in the area, and that she will be able to continue supporting her children and parents, whose economic resources are few.

Choluteca, Honduras -- September 2013

loans.use: to buy shortening, rice, beans, chicken meat, beef, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Félix Pedro  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposa 2 hijos en  un caserío al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta de refrescos naturales y los vende de manera ambulante.  
Don Félix tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El préstamo lo necesita para las compras de azúcar, colorantes, sandias, melones, piña, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Don Félix espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en el negocio más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad.




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Septiembre   del   2013
texts.en:
Félix Pedro is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person.  He lives with his wife and their two children in a small town in the southern part of Honduras.  He works selling natural drinks that he sells as a street vendor.  Félix has done this work for 12 years.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase sugar, food coloring, watermelons, melons, and pineapple.  He hopes that the loan will help increase sales since he will have more products to offer and he can better serve his customers.

Félix hopes to cover the necessities that he has and improve his family's quality of life a little. He hopes that his business continues to grow and in a few years will become larger and well-known in his area.  He hopes that his children will become good people with better opportunities in society.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, food coloring, watermelons, melons, and pineapple for his business.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 32 years old and is married with four children. He earns income mainly from the sale of crops and a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). On his land Amos grows beans, bananas, coffee, maize, and cassava. He also has chickens and goats. 

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. Amos has served as a CKW for the last two years and now looks forward to renewing his contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar-charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate agricultural information about best farming practices to fellow farmers in his village. 

With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Amos will be able to build a better house, meet family needs, and pay school fees for his children. His dream in life is to become a model producer of quality agricultural products.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is from Yerevan town, where he lives with his wife and two children. He is a tailor with many years of experience in that field. He rents a small place in Yerevan, where he provides different tailoring services.

The income that Hayk gathers from the business is hardly enough for covering family's basic costs. So in order to be able to purchase fabric for tailoring clothing and selling it to customers, Hayk needs financial support. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So the loan is very important for Hayk to be able to continue his tailoring business and sustain the family's living.

loans.use: to pay for fabric for tailoring clothing for customers

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophrlia is 45 years old and from Liberia.  She lives in Compound #3 with her six children, ages between 6 and 25 years; only three are in school, and they all live at home. 

Over the past 15 years she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. Some problems she faces are the high prices of fish, but she realizes a little profit. 

She is asking a LRD 24,000 loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her.  She spends eight hours each day in a week selling. 

Her plans are to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: José Emilio

texts.es: José, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, reside en compañía de sus padres en una comunidad rural del municipio de Gracias, Departamento de Lempira. José desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para brindarle un mejor manejo a sus cultivos. Con el apoyo financiero obtenido él espera aumentar su producción y utilizar sus ganancias en la manutención de sus padres.
texts.en: Jose, 32, is single and lives with his parents in the rural community of Gracias, Lempira Department. Jose has worked in agriculture since he was very young, specifically in planting corn and beans. He is currently requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL to invest in buying fertilizers and pay for labor costs to improve management of his crops. With this loan, he hopes to increase production and use the income to care for his parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs to help on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is from Gyumri town. She lives with her husband and son in their small house. 

Near the house where they live, Gyulnara has a small workshop where she tailors different type of linen. She sells the final products at local small markets and also to individual customers. Over years of hard work Gyulnara was able to have a good client base. 

Now this hard-working woman needs financial support to be able to purchase fabric for tailoring linen. Lately she has got a big order from one of the city shops, and she needs to prepare a big portion of linen for them. So, in order to purchase fabric for tailoring linen Gyulnara has applied for this loan. 

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Gyulnara and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fabric for tailoring linen

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 42 years old and is married with seven children. He is a farmer who earns an income from growing coffee, maize, bananas, cassava, and beans. He also raises chicken and goats. Simon earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). CKWs are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area. This data includes information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. Simon has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his contract for the next three years.

Simon is requesting a loan to buy a smartphone, solar charging set and scale to provide vital farming information to his community. His loan will help his work as a CKW and allow him to disseminate agricultural information to members of he village to help them improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the profit from his loan, Simon hopes to start raising poultry to earn more income so he will be able to afford an education for his children through university.

loans.use: to buy a smartphone, solar charging set and scale to provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 50 years old and lives in West Point. She stopped her education in the 12th grade. She is single and has five children, 19 to 30 years old. 

For the past six years now, she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She likes the way people respond to her business. 

She is requesting a second loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, and coal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, and coal for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Gyumri where she lives with her husband and mother-in-law. Three years ago, she started to provide hairdresser services to locals. Over these years of hard and tireless work, she was able to gain a good client base. Now, realizing that the income she earns from providing hairdresser services is important for the family, Mariam wants to increase it. 

Mariam is asking for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for her work. She has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Mariam hopes for lenders' support and she will be very grateful to them for the assistance.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing hairdresser services.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Yerevan town where he lives with his wife, parents, and two school-aged children. He runs a small store in a nearby town where he sells general products for everyday use. Artur is a very hardworking man who works hard to sustain his family's living and provide better conditions for them. The income that he earns from his store is barely enough to cover his family’s needs and a loan is very important to Artur.

Artur is requesting a loan to purchase a new stock of supplies to sell in his store. His request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Artur hopes to receive trust and support from his lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of supplies to sell in his store

loans.name: David Stiven

texts.es: David es un joven emprendedor de 19 años de edad que se caracteriza por su dinamismo y su actitud positiva. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como empleado en una barbería, pero con la experiencia obtenida y con apoyo de un crédito anterior, optó por adecuar un espacio de su casa para iniciar su propia barbería, aprovechando que tiene muchos clientes, pues ya venía prestando el servicio en el tiempo libre, a domicilio o de una forma muy improvisada en su casa. Trabaja arduas jornadas todos los días, pues debe cumplir con su horario laboral y alterna con la prestación del servicio de manera independiente, con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos con los que aporta a la economía de su hogar y, además apoya a su hermano menor pagando cursos de capacitación en este oficio, pues desea trabajar con él en la barbería. Solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito para realizar adecuaciones en su negocio, pues requiere instalar el servicio sanitario, el dinero será para comprar el sanitario, lavamanos, orinal, materiales de construcción (cemento y baldosas) y pagar la mano de obra, esto le permitirá tener su barbería completa y podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, además tendrá su negocio independiente de la unidad familiar. Todo esto le permitirá trabajar de lleno en su proyecto, con el que espera tener muy buenos resultados para que los ingresos personales incrementen y así poder cumplir el sueño de pagar sus estudios universitarios y seguir apoyando a su familia económicamente, dando la oportunidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
David is 19 years old and is known for his entrepreneurial spirit, ambition and positive attitude. He is currently employed in a barbershop, where he has gained a lot of experience, but he wants to have his own business. With the help of a previous loan, David decided to convert a space in his home to start his own barbershop. He says that he already has a lot of customers, and that he has been cutting hair outside of work, both in his customers homes and in the makeshift setup in his house.

David works very hard every day, balancing the hours he is scheduled to work in the barbershop with his independent work. He says that he does this to supplement his income so that he can contribute to his family’s finances. David also helps his younger brother to pay for a training course in barbering, because his brother wants to work with him in the barbershop. 

David is requesting his second loan to make improvements to his business. He says that he needs to install a restroom, and that he will use the loan to buy a toilet, sink, urinal, construction materials such as cement and tile, and to pay for labor. David says that the loan will allow him to finish his barbershop, which will let him provide better customer service in a space independent from the family’s living area. With the restroom installed, he will be able to fully work in his business, which he hopes will be very successful. David hopes to increase his income so that he can realize his dream of paying for his university education. He says that he also wants to continue supporting his family so that they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials and labor to install a restroom in his barbershop.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 48 years old and lives in the town of West Point.  She is married and has five children, between 18 and 30 years old. She was not able to attend school, and only three of her children are attending school. Her husband has his own business. 

Helena has been selling coal in her community for five years. She sells the coal in large sacks.  She likes talking to her customers, but says it's difficult to get the sacks back from them, which results in more expenses. 

Cecelia has requested a loan to purchase more coal for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Noria

texts.en:
Noria is 42 years old and lives in compound #3 with her husband and two children. Her children are in school. Her children's ages are 12 and 16. Noria says she was unable to attend school. 

For four years now, Noria has been selling fish in the local market. She doesn’t have enough income to buy more fish for her business. She spends ten hours each day, six days a week, selling fish. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 43 and single with three children between the ages of five and 19. Her children are currently in school. For the past six years, Theresa has been selling slippers at an open market. She sells imported men’s and ladies slippers and uses her profit to buy more goods and to pay for the education expenses for her children. One of her business difficulties is low sales during the raining season. 

Theresa is requesting a loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more slippers to sell. This will be her fourth loan. In the future, Theresa hopes to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase slippers to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and lives with her boyfriend and three children. She lives in the town of West Point. Martha was able to complete twelfth grade and all of her children are currently in school. Her partner works as a teacher and Martha has run a general store for the past five years. She started her business when her brother gave her some money and some days are good and some days are slow. Martha is proud to support herself and her children.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and other small products to expand her sales.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, and other products to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old and has four children between the ages of eight and 21. She lives in West Point. For the past ten years, Agnes has been selling rice, peppers, palm oil, and other items on a table. One of the problems she faces is the rainy season. Agnes enjoys interacting with her customers and making profit. Being busy makes her proud of her business. 

Agnes is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. This will be her second loan. Agnes plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casada, tiene cinco hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y al hogar. Tiene 4 años de tener un negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece productos alimenticios carnes, arroz, frijoles, maíz, embutidos, lácteos, pan, condimentos, productos enlatados, pastas, productos de limpieza,desinfectantes, desodorante, ambiental etc. EL préstamo que solicito es por 6,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos como carnes, lácteos y granos básicos para el negocio y así poder ofrecerle a los cliente mas productos y obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es poder tener como ayudar con los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 46, is married and has five children.  She lives in the Arizona municipality in Atlántida.  She previously devoted herself to farming and the household.  She has had her business, a store where she sells food products like meat, rice, beans, corn, sausages, dairy products, bread, condiments, canned goods, pastas, cleaning products, disinfectants, deodorants, and air fresheners, etc. for four years.

The loan that she is requesting is for 6,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy more products like meats, dairy products, and basic grains for her business.  This way she will be able to offer her customers more products and get greater income.  Her goal is to be able to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy products like meat, dairy products, and basic grains to stock and sell.

loans.name: Abdelhafeeth

texts.en:
Abdelhafeeth is a 46 years old and married. He lives with his wife and five children, two sons and three daughters, in Qalqilia. All of his children go to schools. 

Abdelhafeeth is an employee at a local company, and this is the only source of income to the family.  He and his family live in a rental apartment, He would like to build his own house to save the rent expenses, but construction materials are very expensive. 

He is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to purchase the needed construction materials like cement and iron.  By applying this loan, Abdelhafeeth will be able to finish his home as soon as possible and live in it with his family before winter. This will improve the family living conditions. 

Abdelhafeeth appears in the photo in his new home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, like cement and iron

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 21-year-old young single man from Deir el Balah. He lives with his mother and brother in a simple house in the city and he appears in this photo. Adnan is a student in a local university where he studies the basic religion of Islam. He is in his last year and will graduate soon. 

Adnan is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. His new laptop will help him prepare his seminar and, after that, to find a job as a teacher. This will help improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Review-Priscilla is 40 years old, a female and married. She has seven children, who are 20, 17, 15, 12, 10, 8 and 5 years old. She supports all these children. She has run a grocery business for the past three years. It is located in Gongoni near Malindi. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,160 from this business. 

Review-Priscilla was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. She is taking her second loan of KES 15,000 which she intends to use to add stock to her business. She will purchase vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, spinach and cabbages. Review-Priscilla, will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, spinach and cabbages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Patrick William

texts.en:
Patrick William is a 52-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Patrick William operates a retail shop and also has a pork joint business to earn extra income. Like most traders, he faces the challenge of price fluctuations and inadequate capital.

Patrick William is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as rice, sugar, and salt to sell. His dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and salt to sell

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco used the previous loan to buy spare parts to sell, and the business has been very profitable. He is a 32-year-old, hardworking man, with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

After realizing the need for more capital to live a modest life, he started a motorcycle spare-parts shop. His personal goals are to buy a plot and build a good residential house, while his business plan is to diverse the business to include motor vehicle spare parts.

John Bosco is requesting for a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She has continued with the business of tailoring and designing clothes, alongside poultry farming, in order to boost her income.

She is mainly facing challenges of customers who delay payment to her, however, she has a vision of educating her children to higher levels of learning. Enid is requesting for loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy used the previous loan to buy shoes to sell.  She is a 30-year-old hardworking woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling second-hand shoes, and she also raises pigs to boost her income. She faces challenges of customers not paying on time and seasonality of the business. Her dreams are to buy land, build a good house for her residence, and expand her shoe business to new areas. Lucy intends to use the loan to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in West Point. She is 37 years old, single, and has four children, ages 9, 13, 17, and 21; they live at home, and three are presently in school.

For the past years, she has been selling pepper in the local market. She enjoys the ways customers flow into her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper for her business. 

Her plan is to build her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper for her business,

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 35 years old and lives in West Point. She’s married and has four children, ages 13, 18, 22, and 24. Only two of them are presently in school in and live at home, while the others are working and live on their own. For the past three years she has been selling rice and soup in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of money that she received from her husband, and she learned how to do it from her mother. What she likes about this business is that it helps her to pay her children's school fees on time. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, meat, pepper, vita, salt, fish, etc. for her business. Her future plans are to save money and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, meat, pepper, vita, salt, fish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: 40-year-old Musu lives in West Point. She is married and has four children, ages 10, 14, 17, and 20. For four years now she has been selling slippers and clothes in the local market. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business. She likes her business because it helps her support her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and clothes for her business, and her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 30-year-old married man from Gaza city. He appears in this photo. He is a father with one son and two daughters who are all younger than 18 years old. Mostafa works as an employee in the public sector and earns a low income that his not enough to cover all of his family’s needs. Mostafa's mother lives with his family and she is a very old woman with some health issues. 

Mostafa is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him to pay part of the costs of an urgent surgery his mother needed.

loans.use: to pay part of the costs of an urgent surgery for his mother

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 37-year-old hardworking woman with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes for a living, and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

Ever changing customer preferences and inadequate capital to keep up with the trends are her major hindrances, while her dreams are to have a modern boutique and educate her children up to the University.

Gladys intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher used the previous loan to buy cows. He is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children, build a permanent home, and buy a car.

He has been dealing in animal sales for the past three years. He started with savings from the wages earned while working at a tea company. His major hardships are customers not paying on time, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal weather. 

However, Christopher's goal is to diversify his business to include retailing, hiring employees to help expand his business, and buying land to grow crops.

Christopher is requesting a loan to buy cross-breed cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cross-breed cows to sell.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia tiene 20 años, vive con sus padres y se va en la Universidad  por la tarde. Es una joven que quiere sobresalir y es por eso que se está esforzando.
Está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería, una vez  que termine su carrera quiere trabajar en su profesión, para poder ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan. Su sueño siempre fue ese y es por eso que da todo de sí.
Ignacia solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases ya que siempre surge algún imprevisto que hay que cubrir.
texts.en:
Ignacia is 20 years old and lives with her parents. She is described as a person who works very hard to excel. Ignacia is currently in her second year of university where she is studying at night to become a nurse. Ignacia has always dreamed of being a nurse, and for this reason she is devoting all of her effort to her studies. She says that after she graduates she wants to work in the nursing profession to help people. 

Ignacia is requesting this loan to pay for her university courses and the incidental educational expenses that always come up.

loans.use: to pay for university courses and incidental educational expenses.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian lives in West Point and she is 31 years old. She is married and has a 16-year-old child who lives at home and attends school. For years now she has been selling school uniforms in the local market. She received a little amount of money from her husband to start this business and learned how to sell from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more school uniforms for her business and her plan is to build a house for her child and educate her child in school.

loans.use: to purchase more school uniforms for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Caacupé, es casada, su marido trabaja como guardia de seguridad y ella trabaja en una empresa de alquileres.
Maria quiere terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar como Licenciada en Enfermería  y de esa manera ayudar a varias personas que necesitan y también tener un ingreso mayor y más seguro para cubrir los gastos de su familia, se está dedicando mucho para ser una buena profesional, útil no solo a sí misma, sino también a los demás. Pide este préstamo para la invertirlo en sus gastos de transporte y también para sus materiales de estudio y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Maria is married and lives in the city of Caacupé. Maria's husband is a security guard and she works in a rental agency, but she would like to become a Registered Nurse. This career change would allow Maria to help people in need and earn a higher income to meet her family's expenses. 

Maria is working diligently to become an excellent nurse, not only for herself, but for others. She is applying for this loan to use the funds for transportation expenses and study materials. Maria is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay transportation costs and to purchase study materials

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 52-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He appears in this photo and is a father with three sons and seven daughters.  For many years, Adnan has worked in agriculture, learning from his father and grandfather. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them in the local market. Adnan uses greenhouses to improve the quality of his crops.

Adnan is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy seeds and seedlings as well as materials to build more greenhouses. His loan will help increase his productivity and his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings, and materials to build greenhouses

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 37-year-old married man with two sons and one daughter. He is from Jenin city and appears in this photo at his farm. Samer works as an employee in the public sector. He also has worked as a farmer for many years and learned from his father and grandfather. Samer plants olive trees and sells olive oil in the Palestinian market. This is very profitable. 

Samer is requesting a loan from FATEN to buy olive seedlings. His loan will help to expand his business and improve his productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy olive seedlings for his farm

loans.name: St Yowana Group

texts.en:
Posiano is a forty-year-old married man with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

Posiano is a fisherman, and with the proceeds he has been able to provide basics to his family. Lack of adequate preservation equipment and bad weather are his major challenges, while his dream is to export fish to other countries.

Posiano intends to use the loan to buy fishing nets to use.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets to use.

loans.name: Mauda

texts.en:
Mauda is a 38-year-old married woman with 3 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a bar business, but also carries out livestock farming in order to earn additional income.

She has hardships of price fluctuations and customers not paying on time, while her vision is to build a house and own a modern bar.

Mauda intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Allen is a 35-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. Nine years ago she decided to start a bar and lodge in order to supplement her farming activities which were seasonal. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university level and set up sustainable income generating activities to secure their future. High cost of rent and price fluctuation are her major challenges but her dream is to own a hotel. Allen intends to use the loan to buy beds for the lodge.

loans.use: to buy beds for her lodge.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 40-year-old married woman with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop but also offers outside catering services in order to raise money to support her family. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are her major challenges. She dreams of educating her children up to the university level and expanding her business to new areas. Margret intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Janaro

texts.en:
Janaro lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He has two children and has been doing this work for twenty years. His primary income sources are crops and  personal business."

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'High returns." His biggest challenge is "Insufficient water." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Janaro was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "low interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Savings are used as collateral."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family," Janaro replied "Improve living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janaro owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, running water" but does not have "electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: To purchase water tanks and pipes.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Sophia is married and has six children. She and her husband both farm their land and are currently growing cereal crops. Sophia is excited to become a beekeeper because it will increase the yield of her crops through pollination. 

This is Sophia's first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to make improvements to her family home.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. He has one child and has been doing this work for fifteen years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Profits.' His biggest challenge is 'Poor transportation.' Animals on the farm have been given the name of 'Mory.'

Eric was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'low interest rates.' This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Members should take responsibility for any unpaid monies.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Eric replied, 'Improve living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Eric owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Rehema is married and has five children. Her husband works in the transportation industry while Rehema runs a small shop. When she and her husband have spare time, they farm their land. They are currently tending to an orange orchard and growing some small crops for home use. Rehema is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper as it will give her a source of honey for home use. 

This is Rehema's first loan, and she plans to use the income from her hives to pay school fees for her children. Her hope for the future is to improve and expand her shop business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Maddah

texts.en: Maddah was born in 1967. He is married and has three children. Maddah has been selling cartons and plastic and wooden boxes for four years. He didn't have a suitable place to store his products. But by expanding his project, he was able to buy a store where he can keep his boxes. To increase his sales and and raise his income to support his children, he is now asking for a loan to buy a larger amount of boxes. He doesn't have enough money to do so, and for this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of cartons and plastic and wooden boxes to trade

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 15 years. His primary income sources are crops and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Returns." His biggest challenge is "insufficient capital." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kairu."

Samwel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Better services." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Members should take responsibility of any unpaid monies."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family" Samwel replied "Improve living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samwel owns the following: "cow" but does not own "pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, running water, TV, DVD" but does not have "electricity, solar power, sewing machine."

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, y comenta que su meta futura es recibirse, ejercer su profesión, tener un buen ingreso e invertir lo que pueda en la agricultura, ya que es a lo que se dedica la familia de ella actualmente.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de profesorado en ciencias básicas, quiere poder enseñar a las personas que al igual que ella quieren aprender y ser alguien en la vida.
Hoy pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y así seguir con sus estudios y estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en: Elvira is from the city of San Ignacio and comments that her future goal is to graduate, practice her profession and earn a good income to invest what she can in agriculture since that’s what her family does at present.  She’s studying to be a science teacher and wants to be able to teach others and at the same time learn herself and become someone in life.  She’s asking for this loan today to pay tuition fees to continue with her studies and get closer to her goals every day.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, se está esforzando por salir adelante y ser una excelente profesional que ayude a su familia.
Comenta que su familia es su principal fortaleza, y que siempre han estado con ella, ayudándola en todo lo que pueden. Maria quiere poder retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por ella y es por eso que quiere ser la mejor.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma liberarse de ese peso y seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta ayuda que recibe que le será muy útil.
texts.en: María is majoring in systems analysis and strives to get ahead and to become an excellent professional that can be of help to her family.  She comments that her family’s her main strength and that they have always been with her supporting her in every way possible.  María would like to repay them for everything they’ve done for her and that’s why she wants to be the best.  She’s asking for this loan to pay her tuition to be free of this worry and continue studying.  She’s grateful for this help she’s getting which will be very useful.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of miraa, which can be chewed like tobacco. He has no children and has been doing this work for 15 years. His primary income sources are crops and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Profits." His biggest challenge is "insufficient capital." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Mutune."

Eric was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Quick services." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Savings are used as collateral."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit his family?" Eric replied, "improve living standards."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Eric owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, running water" but does not have "electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

loans.use: to purchase water pipes

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрору из Явана очень повезло в жизни. Он счастливый отец троих детей. У него 12-летний сын, 13-летняя и 2-летняя дочери. Старшие дети ходят в школу, а младшая дочь не ходит в детский сад, так как ее мать домохозяйка и сама следит за ней. Асрору 39 лет. Он занимается своим любимым делом. В течение 6 лет Асрор предоставляет услуги по ремонту автомашин. Он научился этой профессии у своего отца еще при его жизни. В районе Явана мало машин и соответственно мало механиков. Асрор считает, ему очень повезло со своей работой. Он мог бы работать быстрее, если бы он имел более подходящие инструменты. Асрор хочет закупить подходящие приборы для своего дела и в связи с этим просит кредит для приобретения дрели, болгарки, ключей и других инструментов. Асрор ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Asror, who lives in Yavan, has been very lucky in his life.  He is a happy father of three children.  He has a 12 year old son, and two daughters, one 13 years old and the other one two.  The older children go to school, while the youngest one attends kindergarten under the supervision of her mother, who is a housewife.  Asror is 39 years old.  For the past six years, Asror has been doing his favorite type of work, offering car repair services.  He learned this profession from his father, who has recently passed away.  

There are only a few cars in Yavan and therefore, only a few mechanics.  Asror believes that he has gotten very lucky with his job, and that he could work even faster if only he had better equipment.  Asror is asking for a loan to purchase the right tools for his business, such as drills, grinders and wrenches.  Asror is waiting for your help!

loans.use: To purchase drills, grinders and other equipment for his car repair business.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De V.e.s Group

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia de 44  años de edad soltera y madre de  2 hijos, la Sra. Cecilia tiene un negocio de venta de comida en un pequeño mercado ya hace unos 2 años. La Sra. Cecilia  ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su comida  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos como (arroz, menestras, etc.)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Cecilia   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Cecilia  se le distingue por su chaleco de color negro y se encuentra parada en el medio ,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old, single and the mother of two children. For the past two years Cecilia has sold food in a small market. Cecilia has managed to build a group of loyal customers which generates enough revenue to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own location to sell her meals and make more income. 

Cecilia will use the loan to buy more products like rice, legumes, etc. so she can continue to satisfy her customers and get ahead. Cecilia and the other members of the group are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence they show in awarding a loan to them. Cecilia is wearing her black vest, standing in the center of the group. They say good-bye with the promise to achieve all of their stated goals.

loans.use: to buy legumes and rice

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura proviene de padres separados, y eso le ha dificultado muchas cosas en la vida, mediante el esfuerzo de su madre es que está saliendo adelante, ya que ella la apoya mucho.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, y quiere ser una profesional exitosa y con gran conocimiento para ayudar a las demás personas.
Solicita este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases, y así seguir con sus estudios y esforzándose por salir adelante.
texts.en: Buenaventura’s parents are separated which has caused many difficulties in life.  Thanks to her mother’s efforts she’s getting ahead for she supports her very much.  She’s studying Business Administration and she wants to be a successful professional with vast knowledge to help others.  She’s asking for this loan to pay for her courses and continue with her studies and striving to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Edson, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. He has been selling bricks since 2004.  He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Edson's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans also to buy lorries of sand and more stock of cement and managed to make many bricks. He bought a new machine for making better and strong bricks and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to buy two plots of lands, a TV set, a Radio, paid his children school fees and covered household expenses.  He is really doing very great.  He appreciates the loan which has made his family life better.  He will use this loan to buy more sacks of cement and a lorry of sand to make more bricks. He dreams of increasing his loan amount.

Edson will share this loan with his loan group "KARAFUU" which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement and a lorry of sand to make bricks.

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.ru: Бахромчон имеет маленький лепешечный цех. Он занимается там производством лепешек. Бахромчон женат, является отцом 4-летней дочери и 3-летнего сына и проживает с ними в городе Исфара. Его маленький цех расположен во дворе его дома. Жена Бахромчона помогает ему в деле, это у них семейный бизнес. Они пекут вкусные традиционные лепешки и в горячем виде распределяют по торговым точкам своим клиентам. В данный момент Бахромчон обратился за кредитом, чтобы расширить свой бизнес. Он хочет закупить муку, уголь и печь для выпечки лепешек, чтобы увеличить производство лепешек, естественно это увеличит и доход семьи.
texts.en: Bahromjon has a small bakery where he bakes flat bread.  Bahromjon is married, lives in the city of Isfara, and is a father to a 4 year old daughter and a 3 year old son.  His small bakery is located in his back yard.  Bahromjon's wife helps him with this work, making this be their family business.  They bake delicious traditional flat breads and distribute them to a number of shops and clients.  Currently, Bahromjon is asking for a loan to expand his business.  He wishes to purchase flour, coal and an oven for baking, so he can increase his output, increasing his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase flour, coal and an oven for baking flat bread

loans.name: Las Amigas De Mi Niño Jesus Group

texts.es: La Sra. Yesenia  de 39  años de edad casada  y madre de  3 hijos, la Sra. Yesenia   tiene un  pequeño negocio  de ventas,  de productos de belleza  ya hace un 1 año, La Sra. Yesenia  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos de belleza, y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Yesenia  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Yesenia se le distingue por su polera de color celeste, Se despide  Dejando la promesa que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 39, is married with three children.  She has had a small business selling beauty products for a year.  She’s acquired loyal customers that generate profits to cover her household expenses.  In future, she’d like to have a locale of her own in which to sell her products and earn higher profits. She will use the granted loan to buy more beauty products to continue meeting customer needs and to get ahead this way.  Yesenia’s wearing a sky blue sweater and says farewell with a promise that she’ll reach all her set goals.

Just like Yesenia, the other group members are grateful to Kiva for the granted loan and for the trust placed in them.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Hijas De Villa Group

texts.es: La Sra. Vanessa, tiene 20  años de edad, es soltera  y tiene 1 hijo.la Sra.  Vanessa , se dedica desde hace 5 años  a la venta de chocolatería en un pequeño local ,la Sra. Vanessa  ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas.la Sra. Vanessa  usará el préstamo para poder comprar más variedades de productos de chocolate ,  a la vez la Sra. Vanessa   y todos los integrantes se encuentran agradecidos con Kiva por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Vanessa  se en cuentra en el medio en cuclillas ,Se despide Dejando la promesa que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Vanessa, 20, is single and has a son.  She’s been selling chocolates in a small locale for five years.  She’s acquired a loyal clientele that generates profits for her to cover her household expenses.  In future, she’d like to have a locale of her own in which to sell her products and earn higher profits.  Vanessa will use the loan to buy a wider variety of chocolate products.  Vanessa is kneeling in the center and she says farewell promising that she’ll reach all her set goals.  Like Vanessa, all the group members are grateful to Kiva for the granted loan and for the trust placed in them.

loans.use: to buy chocolate bars.

loans.name: Liz
