texts.es: Liz, de 31 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, esta casada y vive en la casa de sus padre ya que su terreno lo usa para su negocio. El trabajo de Liz actualmente consiste en el alquiler de cuartos. Ha establecido en su terreno 04 cuartos que alquila para uso diario, semanal o mensual a precios cómodos. Para la construcción de estas habitaciones contó con el apoyo de su padre y de su conviviente quienes le brindan su ayuda desinteresada. Recién lleva en esta actividad un mes, ya que anteriormente vendía pollos, pero la demanda de este producto ha disminuido es por eso que ha decidido cambiar de rubro. Ahora se encuentra en pleno acondicionamiento de algunas de las habitaciones, por lo pronto se encuentra en la etapa de pintado para que se vean mejor, a pesar de ello ya tiene potenciales clientes que están a la espera de ocupar los cuartos. Por otra parte, tiene una cierta cantidad de dinero ahorrado que quiere invertir en la compra de un mototaxi para también alquilarlo y de esta forma percibir un pago diario que solventen los gastos de su hogar. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará mallas para cubrir las ventanas de los cuartos que alquila.
texts.en:
Liz, 31 years old, is a very hardworking and determined woman. She is married and lives in her parents' house as she uses her own land for her business. 

At present Liz's work consists of renting out rooms. On her land she has built 4 rooms which are available to rent daily, weekly and monthly at affordable prices. Her father and her partner supported her in the construction of the rooms. They were very generous with their help.

She has only been operating this business for one month. Before that, she sold chickens but the demand for that product dropped, and so she decided to change sector. 

Now she is in the middle of getting some of the rooms ready and so, soon she will be at the painting stage. She is painting them so that they look better. Nonetheless, she already has potential customers who are waiting to occupy the rooms. 

She also has some money saved which she would like to invest in a motorbike taxi, which she will rent too. This activity will provide her with a daily income to cover her household's expenses. 

This is her sixth loan with Kiva. Therefore, she is grateful to the people who are making it possible for her to access this finance. This finance will give her security to progress with her work. She is committed to making her payments in a timely manner. With the amount requested, S/.800 soles, she will buy wire mesh to cover the windows of the rented rooms.

loans.use: to purchase wire mesh

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria continua con la venta de comida y tiene un pequeño restaurante donde ofrece diferentes platos típicos de la región además preparara desayunos, almuerzos, y cenas, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca - Nueva” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, carne, verduras y otras cosas más.  Ya son seis años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.
texts.en: María continues selling food; she has a small restaurant where she sells various traditional regional dishes; she also prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de Huanca-Nueva” communal bank in the city of Cusco and on this occasion needs the loan to buy ingredients like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, meat, vegetables, and others.  She’s been in business for years and does very well.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio continua con la reparación de electrodomésticos como radios, cocinas, Tvs, Dvds, PCs y otros cosas más y tiene un pequeño taller en un centro comercial de la ciudad del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca - Nueva” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como resistencias, condensadores, chips, estaño, soldadura y otras cosas más. Ya son seis años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.
texts.en: Gregorio continues repairing home appliances like radios, stoves, television sets, DVDs, computers, etc.  He has a small shop in a shopping center in the city of Cusco.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de Huanca-Nueva” communal bank in the city of Cusco and on this occasion needs the loan to buy more work supplies like resistors, condensers, chips, tin, solder and many other things.  He’s been in business six years and does very well.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni continua con la venta de ferretería y tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad del Cusco, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca - Nueva” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cables, focos, pinturas y otras cosas más.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.
texts.en: Marleni continues selling hardware in a small stand she has on one of Cusco’s main avenues.  She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de Huanca-Nueva” communal bank in the city of Cusco and on this occasion needs the loan to buy merchandise like cables, light bulbs, paint and other things.  She’s been in business for several years and does very well.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cables, lightbulbs, paint, and other items.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es: Eloy continua con la venta de repuestos electrónicos y tiene una pequeña tienda en uno de los centro comerciales de la ciudad del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca - Nueva” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo resistencias, transistores, chip, cables, parlantes, potenciómetros y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.
texts.en: Eloy continues selling electronics parts in a small store he has on one of Cusco’s commercial areas.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de Huanca-Nueva” communal bank in the city of Cusco and on this occasion needs the loan to buy merchandise like resistors, transistors, chips, cables, speakers, voltmeters and other things.  He’s been in business for several years and does very well.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as resistors, transistors, chips, cables, speakers, voltmeters, and other items.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben continua con la venta de ferretería y tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en una de las avenidas principales de la ciudad del Cusco, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca - Nueva” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cables, focos, pinturas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.
texts.en: Rubén continues selling hardware in a small stand he has on one of Cusco’s main avenues.  He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Señor de Huanca-Nueva” communal bank in the city of Cusco and on this occasion needs the loan to buy merchandise like cables, light bulbs, paint and other things.  He’s been in business for several years and does very well.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cables, lightbulbs, paint, and other items.

loans.name: Layali

texts.en:
Layali was born in 1979. She is married and a mother of 5. Her husband is a retired man who works in agriculture. She lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. 

Layali has been selling clothes for 1 year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy clothes. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of clothes in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit and income; this will help her husband in covering their children's needs. She doesn't have enough money to do so, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of clothes.

loans.name: Luz Aracely

texts.es: Luz tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia desde hace 20 años. Es madre soltera de un niño de  12 años y una niña de 15 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de tamales (comida típica, preparado con masa de maíz, pollo y verduras), además es empleada de un proyecto de calzado  llevado por una empresa a su comunidad. Su principal patrimonio es su vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir.  Con el fin de darle condiciones más seguras a sus hijos ha decidido hacer el cambio del techo de su hogar ya que el sol y las lluvias lo han dañado, además tiene la necesidad de construir una pila para almacenar agua. Debido a lo anterior se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar: lámina galvanizada, clavos, arena y cemento  ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacer la inversión, pero si tiene la capacidad para ir pagando una cuota mensualmente. Espera poder contar con éste apoyo y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 41, has lived in her own house for 20 years.  She’s a single mother of a 12-year-old boy and a 15-year-old girl.  She works selling tamales (a traditional food made from corn dough, chicken and vegetables.)  She’s also employed by a footwear project a firm in her community carries out.  Her main asset is her house which she managed to build with much effort.

Aiming at providing safer conditions for her children, she’s decided to replace the roof at home because the sun and rain have damaged it.  She also needs to build a water storage tank.  

Because of this, she approached FUSAI to request a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, nails, sand and cement because she does not have enough money to make said investment but does have the capacity to make monthly installment payment.  She hopes to get this support to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Trabajando Para  El Futuro Group

texts.es: Ela de 53 años separada con 01 hijo aún dependiente, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Trabajando Para El Futuro” conformada por 08 mujeres emprendedoras y dinámicas. Ela se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir aportando en su hogar. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de vasos y frutas para el preparado de sus refrescos. Poner otro puesto de refrescos es su mayor deseo, pues ella sabe que de esta manera tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Trabajando Para El Futuro” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Ela se encuentra de pie es la primera del lado derecho, viste blusa color  lila y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Ela, 53, is separated and has one child who's still dependent.  Currently she belongs to the Trabajando para el Futuro group, made up of eight enterprising and dynamic women.  Ela makes a living selling beverages.  Thanks to her effort she can keep on contributing to her household.

Ela will use the loan she requested to buy glasses and fruit to make her drinks.  Her greatest desire is to set up another drink stand because she knows she'll earn more profit that way.

Trabajando para el Futuro Group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.  Ela's the first person standing on the right, wearing a lilac-colored shirt and black pants.

loans.use: to buy glasses and fruit

loans.name: Ana Concepcion

texts.es: Ana tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su familia.  Trabaja como empleada desde hace algunos años y de esa forma ha logrado salir adelante y colaborar con la economía del hogar. Ana desea mejoras las condiciones de su vivienda, tales como el piso y la pared ya que no ha logrado darle el acabado final. Es por esta razón  que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y  cemento, etc. Para realizar el repellado  de las paredes de su casa y mejorar el piso. Espera poder contar con el crédito para hacer las mejoras necesarias.
texts.en:
Ana, 27, lives with her family in her own house.  She’s worked as an employee for several years getting ahead this way and contributing towards household expenses.  

Ana wants to improve conditions like floor and walls at home because she’s been unable to give them their finishing touches.  This is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy sand, cement, etc. to seal the walls at home and improve the floor.  She hopes to get this loan so that she can do the necessary improvements.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement.

loans.name: Jano

texts.en:
Jano is a 29-year-old IT specialist from the Zugdidi District, West Georgia. He is married with two school-age children. Jano's wife works as a hair stylist at the local beauty salon and earns a small monthly income. Jano is jobless at the moment. He is a very enthusiastic young man with a great wish to get ahead and ensure his children will have better living conditions. 

Jano is requesting the loan to work within his own profession and start up a computer service business. He has already hired the space and needs equipment to serve the clients. With the received credit, Jano will purchase a used computer and printer. He will offer program installation service, printing, and various types of computer assistance to local people, and get a service fee. 

Jano will generate income and improve the living conditions for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a used computer and printer to start a computer service business.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is 19 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her 2 siblings and her parents. Khetam is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, and she is in her 1st year. 

She is planning to continue her studies and then work in her field of study after graduation to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them from paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Justa Alicia

texts.es: Justa de 47 años de edad,  vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por su compañero de vida, tres hijos, y su pequeña nieta.  Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas y frutas. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y dedicada.  Para ella y su compañero de vida lo principal es su familia por lo que día a día luchan por brindarle mejores condiciones.  Posee una casita muy humilde pero propia, que poco a poco va mejorando, su deseo es hacerle un pequeño cuarto a la cocina ya que por el momento la tiene al aire libre y no es muy seguro para mantener sus pertenencias.  Esta es la razón por la que se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito  que le permita  invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena, etc. Y poder así hacer la construcción de su cocina.
texts.en:
Justa, 47, lives wither family consisting of her spouse, three children and granddaughter.  She works growing and selling fruit and vegetables.  She’s a very hardworking, responsible, dedicated woman.  For her and her spouse their family is most important and they strive daily to provide better conditions for them.

She has a house that’s very humble but nonetheless hers.  She’s gradually been improving it and her wish now is to build a small room for the kitchen because at present it’s out in the open and not very secure for her belongings.  This is the reason why she approached FUSAI to request this loan that will make it possible for her to buy cement, bricks, sand, etc. to be able to build her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab was born in 1972. She is married and a mother of 4. Her husband works in agriculture. She lives with her family in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. 

Zainab has been selling clothes and blankets for 1 year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy only blankets. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends. Now she has added selling clothes to her project and currently wants to buy a larger amount of clothes in order to attract more customers and to raise her profit and income; this will help her husband in covering their children's needs. She doesn't have enough money to do so, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo Alejandro

texts.es: Alfredo de 24 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y dos hijos de 4 años y 3 meses de edad.  Alfredo se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para recorrer las diferentes zonas de su comunidad con su venta, el posee una venta de panes preparados con salchicha y aderezo, los cuales son muy demandados por sus clientes ya que son higiénicos y a  muy buenos precios.  Su principal objetivo es dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, por lo tanto solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera, lámina galvanizada, clavos, etc. Para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que con el tiempo y las lluvias se ha deteriorado y hay filtraciones de agua. Espera poder contar con esta ayuda y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Alfredo, 24, lives in his own house with his immediate family consisting of his wife and two children who are 4 years and 3 months of age.  Alfredo is a hardworking man who is devoted to his family.  He rises very early every day to go throughout the zones in his community to sell.  He sells bread rolls filled with sausage and dressing that are in high customer demand because they are hygienic and priced well.  His main goal is to provide better living conditions for his family which is why he’s approached FUSAI to buy lumber, galvanized metal sheets, nails, etc. to repair his roof at home because time and rain have deteriorated it and it leaks.  He hopes to have this help so that he can provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Maria Apolinaria

texts.es: María, de 40 años de edad habita junto a su grupo familiar en casa muy humilde pero propia. De ella depende su madre quien  está muy anciana y ya no puede trabajar.  Su principal fuente de ingresos es la elaboración y venta de comales de barro de manera artesanal. María se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, dedicada y responsable.  Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto dentro de su propiedad, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado obtener. Con el préstamo comprará: arena, ladrillo, cemento y lámina que son los principales materiales para hacer el cuarto. Espera poder contar con este apoyo para comenzar lo antes posible.
texts.en: María, 40, lives with her immediate family in a house that’s very humble but nonetheless, hers.  Her mother who is quite aged and unable to work any longer depends on her.  Her main source of income is making and selling clay griddles she hand manufactures.  María is noted for being an enterprising, dedicated, responsible woman.  She’s asking FUSAI for this loan to build a small room on her property that she’s acquired with so much effort.  She will use the loan to buy sand, bricks, cement and metal sheets which are the main supplies needed to build the room.  She hopes to get this support to start this as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla was born in 1959. She is a widow who lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla, with her daughter and five sons. 

Khawla has been selling clothes and home products for a year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy home products to trade. Then she started selling them to her neighbors and friends, adding selling clothes to her project. 

She currently wants to buy a larger amount of clothes in order to attract more customers.  That will help her to raise her profit and income to be able to cover her children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amada es maestra, y comenta que le gusta actualizarse permanentemente para aportar en la formación de niños, jóvenes y adultos. 
Comenta además que su esposo la ayuda y apoya mucho en todos sus emprendimientos, y hoy se encuentra estudiando una maestría en educación.
Ella solicita de este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de la maestría y así seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su sueño de ser una master en educación. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Amada's a teacher.  She says she likes to always stay current so she can contribute to the development of children, young adults, and adults.  She also says her husband helps her and supports her a lot in her undertakings.  Currently she's studying for her master's degree in education.

Amada's requesting this loan to be able to cover her degree expenses.  This way she'll continue studying and be closer all the time to her dream of having a master's in education. 

She's grateful for this opportunity, which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay for classes toward her master's degree

loans.name: Felicitas Hermelinda

texts.es: Felicitas continúa con su actividad económica de la artesanía, en la venta principalmente de elementos tejidos y joyería, los cuales comercializa en un puesto de un centro artesanal de la ciudad. Felicitas en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar actividad y comprar mercadería como chompas, bufandas, guantes, gorros y algunas joyas en plata como aretes y collares. Felicitas está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en el mantenimiento de la misma. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Felicitas continues with her crafts-related economic activity consisting mainly in the sale of knits and jewelry in her stand located in one of the city’s crafts centers.  On this occasion, Felicitas is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like sweaters, scarves, gloves, caps and some items of silver jewelry like earrings and necklaces.

She’s very grateful for Kiva’s help to strengthen her business which makes a better quality of life for her family and supporting them possible.  She’s a member of the “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca’s Temple) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Señorita Claudia  es estudiante de la escuela normal de formación de maestros, ella estudia en la normal de Warizata, ella tiene 25 años de edad, desde muy pequeño mostro inclinaciones para la enseñanza por este motivo decidió estudiar esta carrera, sus papas pagan sus gastos de estudio, decidió sacar crédito en la institución para pagar la compra de una computadora personal,   ella es una persona responsable su único deseo es poder ejercer su profesión y así ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia is a student at a teachers college. She attends Warizata teachers college. She is 25 years old, and from young age showed an inclination for teaching. For this reason she decided to study for this career. 

Her parents are paying for her tuition, and she decided to take out a loan at the institution to pay for the purchase of a personal computer. She is a responsible person, and her only wish is to be able to practice her profession and this way help her parents improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her niece. She is single and has a business making and selling brooms in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Cecilia has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for broom-making.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for broom-making.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa with her 6 siblings and her parents. Sarah is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Biotechnology as a 3rd year student. 

She is planning to continue her studies and work in her field of study after graduation in order to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat was born in 1994. She is single and lives with her parents and nine siblings in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Ayat has been selling home products and blankets for a year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy blankets and home products to trade. She started selling them to her neighbors and friends. 

She currently wants to add clothes to her project in order to attract more customers.  That will help her to raise her profit and income to be able to help her family financially. But she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que su meta es culminar la facultad, tener su título de administrador de empresas y así poder, ampliar sus conocimientos para que le puedan servir en el futuro. 
Quiere ser útil para los ingresos de la familia, llegar a superarse, crecer en lo laboral principalmente.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad y así seguir con sus estudios sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
Gustavo is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He says that his goal is to finish college and obtain his degree in business management so he can expand his knowledge and use it in the future. 
He wants to contribute to his family's income and grow professionally.
He is requesting this loan to use it to pay his university fees and be able to continue his studies without worrying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Como estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, Veronica aspira a ser una buena profesional, utilizando sus conocimientos a través de la experiencia y la práctica de manera tal que pueda hacer servicios que sean útiles a la sociedad.
Ella vive con sus padres y hermanos y comenta que está en el último año de la carrera, luchando por salir adelante e ir mejorando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, lo que le permitirá seguir con sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
As a student in the law degree program, Veronica aspires to be a good professional, using her knowledge gained through experience and practice, so as to provide services useful to society. 

She lives with her parents and brothers and says that she is in the last year of the degree program, striving to succeed and gradually improve. She is applying for this loan so that she can use it to pay her fees, which will allow her to continue toward her goals and plans.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha sigue con la actividad de la venta de la venta de ropa de segunda,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un fardo de ropa,   creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de de ropa por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Bertha is still selling secondhand clothing. She says that her previous loan, which she used to buy a bundle of clothing, went well. She expanded her business and increased her customers, and thus her income. She is currently requesting a loan to buy wholesale clothing. She is happy and grateful for this new opportunity she is being offered.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose sigue con su actividad económica como técnico dental, elaborando prótesis que generalmente los vende a los odontólogos. José está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  material que le permita elaborar sus prótesis  y accesorios dentales. José está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en el mantenimiento de su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: José continues working as a dental technician making prosthetic devices he generally sells to orthodontists.  José is asking for the loan to buy supplies that will make it possible for him to continue making prosthetic devices and dental accessories.  He’s very grateful to Kiva for helping him stay in business.  He belongs to the “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca’s Temple) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, age 55, is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family to survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Francisca is now trying to expand her pig business and has decided to venture into swine production. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000. She wants to earn more profit in order to have enough income to meet the daily needs of their family and hopes to save some of her income for unexpected expenditures in the future. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well-known and to manage her business well for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all of her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the growing number of hogs she raises

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: El socio es el señor Luis, él sigue con su actividad económica en la atención de su restaurante picantería en donde expende comida típica de la región. Luis está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, arroz, fideos, menestras y cerveza, para continuar con la producción de su comercio. Luis está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en el mantenimiento de su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Luis continues running his snack bar restaurant where he sells traditional regional food.  He’s asking for a loan to buy meats, rice, noodles, vegetables and beer to continue in operation.  He’s very grateful to Kiva for helping him to stay in business.  He belongs to the “El Templo del Inca” (The Inca’s Temple) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is 20 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her 3 siblings and her parents. Her mother is a retired woman. 

Lana is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Marketing and is in her 2nd year. She is planning to continue her studies and work in her field of study after graduation in order to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is married with 3 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines.

Gilda sells different products to earn a living, and she has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional goods to sell such as coffee, milo, toothpaste, shampoo, soap, sacks of rice, soy sauce, vinegar, and soft drinks.

Gilda has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her store.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Mirardo

texts.es: El Sr. Mirardo tiene 37 años,  tiene una hija de las edades de 7 años,  el se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su puesto de venta de condimentos y especias para sazonar las comidas,  su tienda se encuentra ubicado en la zona 9 de Abril,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Mirardo utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de una moledora industrial para moler comino y ajíes   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, el va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando productos. Su deseo por su negocio es tener una  tienda más grande y surtida y así de esta manera incrementas su clientela y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en: Mirardo is 37 years old and has a 7-year-old daughter. He has a stall selling condiments and spices to season food. His store is located in the 9 de Abril neighborhood. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. Mirardo will use the loan to buy an industrial grinder to grind cumin and dried peppers. He is requesting this loan so he can stock his business. He will use the profits to keep buying products. He would like to expand his shop and stock it with more products so he can increase his customer base and thereby his income.

loans.use: to buy an industrial grinder.

loans.name: Perlas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PERLAS,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mary en la foto es la que esta vestida con la blusa negra y el suéter azul,  ella  se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mary va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de refrescos por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio,  la Sra. Mary es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que este préstamo le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: The Perlas village bank has eight members, six women and two men. The president of the group is Mary, who in the photo is wearing a black shirt and a blue sweatshirt. She sells a variety of soft drinks in her stall in a busy market in the city of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Mary will use this loan to buy soft drinks at wholesale to stock her stall and be able to offer a variety of products to her customers. She is requesting the loan so she can keep improving her business. Mary is a hardworking person. She is happy for the opportunity she's been given, since this loan will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Destacadas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento DESTACADAS está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. América en la foto es la de la polera roja y pantalón jean,  tiene 24 años, un hijo de la edad de 9 años,   ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. América  va a usar este préstamo  para comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. América enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola.
texts.en: The Destacadas village bank has eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the group is América, who in the photo is wearing a red sweatshirt and jeans. She is 24 years old and has a 9-year-old son. She sells cosmetics by catalog and promotes beauty products. She sells door to door, visiting homes, public and private organizations, and different neighborhoods with her products. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. América will use this loan to buy cosmetics on sale so she can stock her business. She is requesting the loan to have a variety of products to meet her customers’ needs. América faces challenges in her business, such as serving her customers efficiently, and she will use her profits to improve her family’s quality of life, since this is her only source of income and the only way she can support herself.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics on sale.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Banco del Desarrollo” en la ciudad del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de ropa, venta de comida y venta de útiles de escritorio, algunos socios brindan servicios de turismo e informática y otros trabajan en hospitales, en clínicas dentales y otras en entidades públicas y privadas. La socia Carmen nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene un hijo hermoso. La socia trabaja como administradora de una pastelería y le va muy bien, ella también tiene su propio negocio que es una ferretería. Ya son 7 años que tiene el negocio de la ferretería y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carmen desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo clavos, pinturas y otras cosas más que faltan en la tienda. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors from the city of Cusco formed the “Banco de Desarrollo” (Development Bank) communal bank.  It consists of people who are always seeking ways to get ahead and with their daily effort provide a better future for their children.  The members carry out a variety of economic activities like clothing sales, food sales, office supplies sales.  Some of the members work providing tourism services and computer services and others work in hospitals, dental clinics and  other private and public entities.

Carmen, 32, was born in Cusco and she has a beautiful son.  She works managing a pastry shop and does very well.  She also has her own business, a hardware store.  She’s had it for seven years now and does excellently well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Carmen wants to buy merchandise like nails, paint and other things needed in the store.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity being provided and commit to make their payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District, Province and Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas and it’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history.  It’s an enchanting city in the southern part of the country.  Cusco is commercial, known as a tourism center and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu-Picchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Cylin

texts.en:
Cylin, age 43, is from Tacdog, Siquijor, Siquijor, Philippines. She is a widow raising one school-age child.  PMPC supported Cylin by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family to survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Cylin is now trying to expand her pig business, and she has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. She is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy additional feeds and piglets. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well-known and to manage the business well for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send her child to school in order to have a stable career.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is married with 4 children. She is 64 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Philippines.

Jovencia sells variety of products to earn a living, and she has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional goods such as milk, milo, coffee, sugar, biscuits, crackers, sardines, noodles, candies, toothpastes, soaps, and detergents.

Jovencia has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 61, is from Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. The wages that her husband earns are not adequate to sustain the daily needs of their family. So Emma started a business, a food stall or "carenderia." She has been in this business for 5 years to earn additional income for their family.

In 2006, Emma applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to join. She maintains the status of a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Emma is now trying to expand her business and has also decided to venture into a sari-sari (general) store. She wants to gain more profits and to have enough to meet her family's needs, especially those of her children. In order for Emma to realize her dreams, she presented her proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000. She will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy the raw ingredients needed for her food stand and restock inventories for the sari-sari store. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to be well-known and to manage the business well for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her food business and to restock inventories for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy earns a living offering rooms and motorbikes for rent. She is 27 years old and single and lives in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is now well-known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new televisions and air conditioners and has been able to save from them. Her services are self-sustainable and the business has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 25,000 per month.  

Juvy is seeking a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase beds, tables, chairs, cabinets, and motorbikes. This is a regular loan and will be repaid in few months. Juvy is a new member of PMPC. She is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: To purchase beds, tables, chairs, cabinets, and motorbikes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 57-year-old woman from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married and gifted with 3 children. 

In order to survive, Marilyn and her husband are engaged in corn production to earn a living. Her family has been in this business for 20 years as their main source of income. 

In 2007, Marilyn became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now she wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 10,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs for corn production. She dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family and to earn an adequate income from her business.

Marilyn deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC and she repays her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs for corn production

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda, age 62, is happy tending her little "carenderia". She is married with three children who are adults. The "carenderia" is her means of earning a living in supporting her family. Fortunately, her "carenderia" is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. 

Rolanda keeps on running the "carenderia" well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Rolanda believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition. She has reached her second year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 3,000 for the "carenderia". Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there she could afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients and kitchen utensils to be used in her food stand.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Camino Al Sol Group

texts.es: Doña Xinia es la Tesorera de Banco Mujer Camino al sol, con 39 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo, su hija menor y un nieto. Está mujer tan emprendedora siempre ha buscado la manera de ayudar a su familia y a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su actividad es la producción de plátano tostado, cuenta con pocos utensilios para desarrollarlo y su plan de inversión del crédito es la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de la tostadora y aumentar su producción. Ella ya ha tenido 3 préstamos anteriormente y son los que le permitieron comprar lo que tiene actualmente. Doña Xinia tiene muchos planes a futuro, como  ayudar con los estudios de su hija menor, así como agrandar su negocio y aumentar producción, también convertir a sus compañeras de grupo en socias de la Tostadora, generando un ingreso adicional para todas sus 7 compañeras que además desarrollan actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Xinia, 39, is treasurer of the “Camino al Sol” (Road to the Sun) communal bank.  She’s married with three children.  She lives with her husband, youngest daughter and grandson.  She’s such an enterprising woman that she’s always looked for ways to help her family and to help her husband with household expenses.  

Her activity is making toasted banana chips.  She has the utensils needed to make it and her investment plan is to buy building supplies to improve the toaster and increase production.

She’s had three previous loans and they made it possible for her to buy what she currently owns.  Xinia has many plans for the future like helping with her youngest daughter’s schooling, expanding the business  and increasing production.  She also wants to have her fellow group members become members of the toaster generating additional income that way for all seven of her companions who also carry out commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Muheeb

texts.en:
Muheeb is 19 years old. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his 2 brothers and his parents. 

Muheeb is studying for a Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering and is in his 2nd year. He also works at an audio station. He is planning to continue his studies and work in his field of study after graduation in order to start helping his family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them from paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is 20 years old. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her brother and her parents. 

Walaa is studying for her Bachelor's degree in Drama and is in her 3rd year. She is planning to continue her studies and work in her field of study after graduation in order to start helping her family financially. They are currently facing a financial crisis, which is preventing them from paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and lives in Brgy. Sta. Maria, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Arlene is married with 4 children. 

To earn a living, Arlene has a business selling snacks, specifically pancake vending. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan to to buy ingredients for her snack vending and to use as additional capital.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she would like to expand her business in order to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending and to use as additional capital

loans.name: Honey Meashell

texts.en:
Honey Meashell is 25 years old, married, and a resident of Brgy. Manga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have 2 children, both of whom are in school. Starting with capitalization of PHP 3,000, Honey Meashell opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. In addition to this financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits provided by the co-op. She became a member in July 2013. 

Honey Meashell is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida has been working as a farmer for over 50 years.  Together with her husband Nicolas, they plant corn and cactus which they sell at the local market.  Although every year physical labor gets harder, they continue working everyday from sunrise to sundown. 

Placida and Nicolas are very happy that their daughter Minerva has come back home after some years of living on her own in a neighboring town.  Minerva came back to help her parents with the field work and because she knows that they will soon need a caregiver.  Minerva is thankful for the sacrifices her parents made every day for her and sees this as a way to show her appreciation.  

The family is excited to be together but has been living in a single bedroom.  Minerva used the few saving she had to start building a room but she soon realized that she does not have enough.  Placida has been saving for the last three months to finish building Minvera’s room. 

She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed.  Since all family members work on the field and have no proof of their income, they do not have access to credit from banks or other organizations.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new room will give Minerva her own space and privacy but will still be close enough to her parents.

loans.use: To buy materials to finish building a room for her daughter

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Until recently Juana lived with her husband Pedro in what seemed to be a comfortable house.  Maria Elena, one of their children, moved in a couple of months ago with her four kids.  Maria Elena is a hard working mom with her own business, a beauty salon.  When her father, Pedro, couldn’t work as a farmer any more because of his age, Maria Elena employed her mother as an assistant at the salon. 

Maria Elena has been running her business for the last 15 years and making around $700USD a month.  However, Maria Elena was recently divorced and her parents welcomed her back to their home to give her and her children a place to live.  Maria Elena is saving to one day have her own place so tries to avoid complaining about the small space and the fact that she shares a tin ceiling bedroom with her kids and a bathroom with the rest of the house.  Juana knows the space is too small, and that it will be years before her daughter can save enough to move to a house of her own. 

Juana is thankful to her daughter for giving Pedro and her an income.  In return, Juana has been saving to build a new bedroom, install proper roofs and build a bathroom for the new family members in the house.  She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed.  Because of her age, Juana is not able to get a loan from other banks or organizations.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new room will give this extended family a safe place to live and grow.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room and bathroom for her daughter and grandchildren

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela lives with her husband, Anastacio, and two children, Luis Felipe and Lucero, in Totolapan Morelos.  Maricela has been working in the market buying and selling crops for a local employer.  Anastacio works in the fields employed by one of their neighbors. 

Maricela and Anastacio bought a piece of land 8 years ago and had great plans to build a house for the whole family.  Maricela became pregnant with Lucero and had to delay their building plans since she had to stop working for a while.  Today the family lives in what could have been their dream house with a tin roof, and walls made out of what they could find to shelter them from the weather outside.  They do everything in a single room and have no proper bathroom.  

Today Maricela and Anastacio make around $700 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible for them.  For the last three months Maricela and Anastacio have been saving to finish building the two rooms, the bathroom and put a proper roof on top of their house.  Maricela needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials.  This addition will give everyone a secure shelter and the space they need to fully develop.  

The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new construction will give this family the home they have been dreaming of for so long.  Maricela is aware that dedication and hard work is what makes dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her house

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a 39-year-old married woman. She has three children, 10, 5 and 3 years old respectively, whom she supports. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET officer.  Kadzo sells fish and has been in this business for five years. Her business is located at Timboni in Watamu.  She earns a monthly income of ksh. 5,000 (Kenyan shillings) from her business.  

She is taking her second loan of ksh. 20,000, which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying more fish. She repaid her previous loan of ksh. 20,000 successfully. 

Kadzo will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
A 50-year-old married father of four, Nestor lives in La-o Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. For the past 10 years he has earned his living through fishing, and is now requesting a loan to purchase a net and other fishing materials.

A member of PMPC for one year, Nestor hopes to buy new pumpboat in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 59 years old. She is very responsible in handling her household obligations, and she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children at Brgy. Minsubong, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a farmer who plants bananas, and she also teaches day care students in the area.

Fe wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put food on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy additional banana seedlings and farm inputs

loans.name: Roxan

texts.en:
Roxan, age 36, is happily tending her little "carenderia," or food stall.  She is married with three children who are infants or in school. The carenderia is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her business is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Roxan keeps on running the carenderia well, despite increased competition from other stores. Roxan believes that, with PMPC's support, they will sustain the business as one family and beat the competition.  

Roxan has reached the end of her first year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 for the carenderia. Expanding her inventory of supplies will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the status of a member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy meat, rice, toppings, and other ingredients and kitchen utensils to be used in her food stand.

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en: Hardworking mother best describes Felixberta, 48 years old, residing in Binoongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. Felixberta is married and has five children who are in school and adult ages. The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain the daily needs for their family. So, Felixberta started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” Felixberta has been in the business more than seven years now. She wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would be able to send her children to college. In order for Felixberta to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 14,900 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed for the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: To buy meat, rice toppings, ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Mamilita

texts.en:
Mamilita is 55 years old and lives in Baybay Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She industriously cares for her fishing activities. She is married with eight children. Her husband is a fisherman who never gets tired of supporting their big family. She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well.  Mamilita has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now Mamilita sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 50,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to finance seaweed cultures and to buy additional nets and other fishing materials. She deeply wishes for a good education to her kids and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to finance seaweed cultures and to buy additional nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, who is 65 years old, is happy living with her family. She lives in Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

She has a sari-sari store where she gets her source of income.

Rosalinda has become a good member of PMPC. Indeed she has applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 to have an additional capital for her sari-sari store business for additional income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Maria Teresita

texts.en:
Maria Teresita is from Dona Consuelo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 61 years old and is a widow with 5 children. Being a breadwinner for the family, she has experienced hardships. In order to survive, this industrious and brave woman started a little sari-sari store (general store) business to earn a living.

Last year, Maria Teresita applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to join. She maintains the status of a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Maria Teresita requested financial assistance in the amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store. As the store is her main source of income, she hopes the loan will help in the expansion of her business and will help her to meet the daily needs of her family. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart. Someday, she will be happy to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Preciosa

texts.en:
Preciosa is 65 years old  and is a married resident of Oroquieta City, Philippines. She opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. 

Now she is applying for 8,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice, canned goods, soft drinks, and other goods for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
A hard-working mother best describes Letecia, who is 52 years old and resides in the Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. 

Letecia is married and has five children who are in school.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family. So Letecia started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” She has been in that business more than two years now. 

Letecia wants to expand her food stand business.  She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially her children, and she would like to be able to send her children to college. 

In order for Letecia to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 10,000 additional capital.  She will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things needed in her food stand. 

She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: To buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils, and other things needed in her food stand.

loans.name: Bliss

texts.en:
Bliss is 40 years old and married, with four children. She lives in Mitimos Rizal Zamboanga del Norte. 

Bliss has engaged in the fuel/gasoline business for almost six years, earning a monthly income of PHP 6,000.  She has requested a new loan to purchase 500 liters of gasoline and also copra buying.  Bliss has been a CUMI member of Paglaum since 2012. 

She aims to have more savings out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase 500 liters of gasoline to retail

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat was born in 1958. She is divorced and lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba with her children. One of her children is a student. 

Nemat has been supporting herself and her children by selling cosmetic products for 5 years. She started her project by selling a small quantity of products. Then she started to expand it slowly. Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of cosmetic products to raise her profit and income, which will help to support herself and her children. She doesn't have enough money to do so, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa was born in 1993. She is single and lives with her parents and three siblings in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Wafaa has been working at her own mini-market selling foodstuffs for two years now. She started her project by selling a small quantity of her products. Then she started expanding it slowly. 

Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of foodstuffs and drinks in order to raise her profit and to help her family in improving its living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more products of foodstuffs and drinks for her mini-market

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Мухиддин из района Явана женатый мужчина. Он, как и большинство жителей родного района решил заняться скотоводством. Ему 34 года. У Мухиддина только одна дойная корова, обеспечивающая его детей молоком. Он хочет купить двух коров и начать бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. Мухиддин за скотом будет ухаживать сам. Его стартовый капитал составляет 1000 таджикских сомони. Это маленькая сумма для начала такого бизнеса и поэтому он обратился за кредитом и просит недостающую сумму в займы. Мухиддин собирается приобрести две коровы, которые по его словам станут основой для начала его бизнеса. В дальнейшем от их выгоды он планирует расширить поголовья скота. Если его дела пойдут так как он задумал, то все в его жизни и жизни его детей и жены будет хорошо. И началом в  его светлое будущее станут две коровы. Помогите Мухиддину купить их, чтобы он начал деятельность.
texts.en:
Muhiddin is 34 years old, married, and lives in the Yavan region.  Like the majority of the residents of this region, he has decided to go into the cattle raising business.  He has only one milking cow, which provides the milk for his children.  He wants to buy two cows and start a business in fattening cattle for resale.  Muhiddin will take care of the cattle himself.  He has 1,000 Tajik somoni for his startup capital.  As this is too small an amount to start the business, he applied for a loan for the rest of the money he needs.  

Muhiddin plans to buy two cows, which he explains will form the basis of his business.  In the future, with the income that they bring, he plans to expand his herd.  If everything goes according to his plans, he, his wife, and children will have a good life.  These two cows will be the beginning of their bright future.  Please help Muhiddin buy them so he can start his business.

loans.use: to buy two cows to start a business

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah was born in 1971. She lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Najah has been making pastries for 2 years. She started her project by making small quantities of pastries in her house and selling them to her neighbors in order to help her husband financially. Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of the necessary materials for her pastries, such as flour, in order to increase her productivity, which will increase her profit and income. She doesn't have enough money to buy the necessary materials, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to make pastries.

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en:
Fayzeh was born in 1978. She is single and lives with her parents and six siblings in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. 

Fayzeh has been selling blankets for a year. She started her project using a small amount of money to buy blankets only. She started selling them to her neighbors and friends. 

Now she wants to buy a larger amount of blankets in order to attract more customers.  That will help her raise her profit and income to be able to help her family financially. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Гузал позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй она живёт в горной местности, у неё есть маленький дом. Чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым Гузал вместе с мужем ведут свой бизнес. Гузал занимается животноводством. Они покупают маленьких телят и потом выращивают их, затем продают полученное мясо и молоко. Муж Гузал также занимается земледелием, что приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Сейчас Гузал с мужем усердно работают над тем, чтобы расширять свой бизнес, и получать больше дохода, чтобы качественно удовлетворять нужды и потребности своей семьи. Также Гузал хочет построить новый коровник для скот, но у неё недостаточно денежных средств. Чтобы расширить бизнес животноводства, Гузал хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку скота. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Guzal is a hardworking woman with a positive outlook.  She is married and has four children.  She and her family live in a mountainous area and she has several small houses.  In order to provide their children with all the necessities, she and her husband run their own business.  They are in the cattle business, buying young calves, raising them, and then selling their milk and meat.  Guzal's husband also farms, which brings in a supplemental income for the family.  

Guzal and her husband work very hard to expand their business and earn a larger income so that they can satisfy their family's needs and requirements in a high quality manner.  Guzal also wants to build a new barn for her cattle, but she doesn't have the financial means to do so.  Guzal wants to buy several more head of cattle in order to expand their cattle business.  And so, Guzal applied to MDO Arvand for a loan with which to buy cattle.  She is hoping for a decision in the affirmative and would like to thank MDO Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle
